required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Sedation for Endoscopic Procedures - a Follow-up Study of Efficiency and Safety

brief_summary.textblock: Endoscopic procedures for biliary strictures, stenting or drainage (ERCP) and ultrasonic imaging or biopsies (EUS) are performed under sedation or anesthesia. The main purpose of the study is to evaluate aspects of procedure treatability and patients´ quality of recovery.

detailed_description.textblock:
The main aim of this study is to evaluate the effects on treatability and procedure failur; also aspects of post-procedure quality of recovery from patients cognitive function and from the choice of sedation/anesthesia for ERCP and EUS-procedures.
Before endoscopic procedures, patients do not always read the written information sent to them. That´s a problem since patients tend to be insufficient prepared for the procedures. Therefore, evaluation of patients' health literacy was performed.
Patients are sedated (patient-controlled sedation or by nurse anesthetists) or in general anesthesia. No randomisation.

primary_outcome.measure: Dimensions of recovery recorded by Quality of Recovery 15 swedish version
primary_outcome.description: Quality of recovery (QoR15 swedish version) Max 150 points Min 0, higher scores are better

primary_outcome.measure: Dimensions of recovery recorded by Quality of Recovery 15 swedish version
primary_outcome.description: Quality of recovery (QoR15 swedish version) Max 150 points Min 0, higher scores are better

primary_outcome.measure: Dimensions of recovery recorded by Quality of Recovery 15 swedish version
primary_outcome.description: Quality of recovery (QoR15 swedish version) Max 150 points Min 0, higher scores are better

secondary_outcome.measure: Health literacy measured by the use of FHL (swedish version)
secondary_outcome.description: Health literacy (FHL swedish version), Max 0 Min 5, 0 is good, 5 is bad

secondary_outcome.measure: Aborted or increased difficulty to performed the planned procedure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of procedure to the end of it (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Procedure failure, numbers of aborted procedures and numbers of difficult performance

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients (≥18 years) scheduled for ERCP or/and EUS

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients (≥18 years)
- Patients cheduled for ERCP or/and EUS
- Patients who have given their informed and written concent to participate
Exclusion Criteria:
Patients with
- confusion
- dementia
- communication problems.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Senior nurse anesthetist, Researcher, Principal Investigator
